data.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
data.text: Workout of the Day 26.10.2025 WODDAILYSWEAT For Quality 6 Rounds 3:00 Row/Ski Erg 20 Box Stepups 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16) 10 Ring Rows Sweat: 16/8 Train: 20/12 Compete: 24/16"
data.full_text:
Workout of the Day

26.10.2025

WOD
DAILYSWEAT


For Quality
6 Rounds
3:00 Row/Ski Erg
20 Box Stepups
15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
10 Ring Rows


Sweat: 16/8
Train: 20/12
Compete: 24/16"

ai_explanation.explanation:
Workout Overview


Hey everyone! Todayâ€™s WOD is designed to build your endurance and strength while focusing on quality movement. Weâ€™ll be completing **6 rounds** of a combination of rowing or skiing, box step-ups, kettlebell sumo deadlift high pulls, and ring rows. The goal here is to maintain good form throughout each movement, ensuring that weâ€™re not just rushing through the reps but really focusing on quality. Letâ€™s break it down step by step!


Workout Components


1. Row/Ski Erg (3:00)

Technique Steps:
  • **Set Up**: Adjust the damper setting on the rower or ski erg to a comfortable level (around 3-5 for most).
  • **Grip**: Sit tall, grab the handle with both hands, and keep your back straight.
  • **Rowing/Skiing**:
  • For rowing: Push through your legs, lean back slightly, and pull the handle towards your chest.
  • For skiing: Use your arms to pull down while engaging your core and legs to stabilize.
  • **Breathing**: Inhale as you prepare, exhale during the pull.

    • Form Tips:
  • Keep your core engaged to protect your lower back.
  • Use your legs first, then your back, and finally your arms for an efficient pull.
  • Maintain a steady rhythm; donâ€™t rush!

    • Scaling/Modifications:
  • If youâ€™re new to rowing or skiing, reduce the time to 2 minutes or focus on technique rather than speed.
  • Consider using a lighter resistance setting if youâ€™re struggling with form.

    • 2. Box Step-Ups (20 reps)

    Technique Steps:
  • **Set Up**: Stand facing the box with your feet hip-width apart.
  • **Step Up**: Place one foot firmly on the box, pressing through your heel to lift your body up.
  • **Stand Tall**: Bring your other foot up to the box, standing fully upright.
  • **Step Down**: Reverse the movement by stepping back down one foot at a time.

    • Form Tips:
  • Keep your chest up and shoulders back throughout the movement.
  • Ensure your entire foot is on the box to avoid slipping.
  • Use your legs, not your back, to lift yourself up.

    • Scaling/Modifications:
  • Use a lower box if youâ€™re unsure about your balance or strength.
  • If you have knee issues, consider stepping up to a platform or using a bench.

    • 3. Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (15 reps)

    Technique Steps:
  • **Set Up**: Stand with your feet wider than shoulder-width, toes slightly pointed out, kettlebell on the floor between your feet.
  • **Deadlift**: Hinge at your hips, keeping your back straight, and grab the kettlebell with both hands.
  • **Pull**: Drive through your heels to stand up, pulling the kettlebell up towards your chin, keeping your elbows high.
  • **Lower**: Reverse the movement, lowering the kettlebell back to the floor.

    • Form Tips:
  • Keep the kettlebell close to your body during the pull.
  • Engage your core and maintain a neutral spine.
  • Focus on using your legs to initiate the lift.

    • Scaling/Modifications:
  • Use a lighter kettlebell if youâ€™re new to this movement.
  • If kettlebells are not available, you can substitute with dumbbells or perform a bodyweight squat.

    • 4. Ring Rows (10 reps)

    Technique Steps:
  • **Set Up**: Adjust the rings to a height where you can comfortably reach them while standing.
  • **Grip**: Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight.
  • **Pull**: Engage your core and pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
  • **Lower**: Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position.

    • Form Tips:
  • Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
  • Avoid letting your hips sag; engage your core throughout.
  • Focus on a controlled movement rather than rushing through.

    • Scaling/Modifications:
  • If rings are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows on a barbell or use a TRX.
  • Adjust the angle of your body to make it easier or harder.

    • Loading and Rep-Modification Options


  • **Sweat**:
  • Row/Ski: 2:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 16/8 inch box
  • Kettlebell: 16/8 kg
  • Ring Rows: 8 reps

  • **Train**:
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 20 reps at 20/12 inch box
  • Kettlebell: 20/12 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

  • **Compete**:
  • Row/Ski: 3:00
  • Box Step-Ups: 20 reps at 24/16 inch box
  • Kettlebell: 24/16 kg
  • Ring Rows: 10 reps

    • Strategy Advice:
  • Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout. Itâ€™s better to go slower and keep good form than to rush and risk injury.
  • Break up the reps if needed, especially on the kettlebell high pulls and ring rows, to maintain quality.
  • Stay hydrated and take short breaks between movements if necessary.

    • Alright team, letâ€™s get after it! Remember, quality over quantity is the name of the game today. Have fun, and letâ€™s crush this WOD together! ðŸ’ª

combined_content.title: CrossFit MINS Workout
combined_content.workout_text:
WOD:

For Quality

6 Rounds:

  • 3:00 Row/Ski Erg
  • 20 Box Step-ups
  • 15 Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift High Pulls (24/16)
  • 10 Ring Rows

    • Sweat: 16/8

    Train: 20/12

    Compete: 24/16

Ring Rows (10 reps) #### Technique Steps: - **Set Up**: Adjust the rings to a height where you can comfortably reach them while standing. - **Grip**: Grab the rings with an overhand grip and lean back, keeping your body straight. - **Pull**: Engage your core and pull your chest towards the rings, squeezing your shoulder blades together. - **Lower**: Slowly lower yourself back to the starting position. #### Form Tips: - Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels. - Avoid letting your hips sag; engage your core throughout. - Focus on a controlled movement rather than rushing through. #### Scaling/Modifications: - If rings are too challenging, you can perform inverted rows on a barbell or use a TRX. - Adjust the angle of your body to make it easier or harder. ## Loading and Rep-Modification Options - **Sweat**: - Row/Ski: 2:00 - Box Step-Ups: 16/8 inch box - Kettlebell: 16/8 kg - Ring Rows: 8 reps - **Train**: - Row/Ski: 3:00 - Box Step-Ups: 20 reps at 20/12 inch box - Kettlebell: 20/12 kg - Ring Rows: 10 reps - **Compete**: - Row/Ski: 3:00 - Box Step-Ups: 20 reps at 24/16 inch box - Kettlebell: 24/16 kg - Ring Rows: 10 reps ### Strategy Advice: - Focus on maintaining a steady pace throughout the workout.
